required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Exploring the Efficacy and Safety of Siponimod in Patients With Secondary Progressive Multiple Sclerosis (EXPAND)
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter, Randomized, Double-blind, Parallel-group, Placebo-controlled Variable Treatment Duration Study Evaluating the Efficacy and Safety of Siponimod (BAF312) in Patients With Secondary Progressive Multiple Sclerosis Followed by Extended Treatment With Open-label BAF312.

brief_summary.textblock: Evaluate the safety and efficacy of Siponimod (BAF312) versus placebo in a variable treatment duration in patients with secondary progressive multiple sclerosis (Core Part) followed by extended treatment with open-label BAF312 to obtain data on long-term safety, tolerabiilty and efficacy (Extension Part).

primary_outcome.measure: The delay in time to confirmed disability progression as measured by EDSS.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, every 3 month up to the maximum of approximately 3 years
primary_outcome.description: Confirmed disability is defined as an Increase of score of 1 point in patients with baseline score of 3.0 to 5.0 and 0.5 point increase with baseline score of 5.5 to 6.5.

secondary_outcome.measure: Efficacy of BAF312 relative to placebo in confirmed worsening of 25 foot walk test
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline , every 3 months up to the maximum of approximately 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: Delay in time to 3 month confirmed worsening of at least 20% from baseline in the timed 25 foot walk test.

secondary_outcome.measure: Efficacy of BAF312 relative to placebo in reducing the increase in T2 lesion volume
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, every year up to the maximum of approximately 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: The reduction of the increase in the T1 lesion volume.

secondary_outcome.measure: The delay in time to confirmed disability progression as measured by EDSS.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, every 6 months up to the maximum of approximately 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: Confirmed disability is defined as increase of score of 1 point in patients with baseline score of 3.0 to 5.0 and 0.5 point increase with baseline score of 5.5 to 6.5.

secondary_outcome.measure: Efficacy of BAF relative to placebo in annualized relapses rate and time to the first relapse
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline every 3 months up to the maximum of approximately 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: BAF312 vs placebo measured by the effect on confirmed relapses rate, the time to the first relapse, and proportion of patient free from relapses.

secondary_outcome.measure: Overall response rate on the MSWS-12.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, every 6 months up to the maximum of approximately 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: The overall response of the effect of BAF312 compared to placebo patients on the patient reported outcome form MSWS-12.

secondary_outcome.measure: Effect on inflammatory disease activity and burden of disease as measured by MRI
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, every 12 month up to the maximum of approximately 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: Effect of BAF312 relative to placebo on disease activity and burden of disease as measured by Gd-T1 lesion, new/enlarged T2 lesion, and brain atrophy on brain MRI scans.

secondary_outcome.measure: effect on 3-month confirmed disability progression as defined by EDSS in predefined sub-groups
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, every 3 months up to the maximum of approximately 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: effect on confirmed disability progression in pre-defined subgroups, including patients with or without superimposed relapses, rapidly evolving patients with 1.5 point or greater change in EDSS score in 2 years prior to enrollment into the study. Patients with score of 4 or more in MSSS and those who don't meet this criteria.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with adverse events during the Core Part
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, every 3 months up to the maximum of approximately 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: Safety analysis will be performed on AE by CTCAE grade, serious AEs and Study drug related AEs and the AEs leading to discontinuation of study drug.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with abnormal lab tests during the Core Part
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, every 3 months up to the maximum of approximately 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: Safety analysis will be performed on lab abnormalities will be based on CTCAE grades

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with adverse events during the Extension Part
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Following the Core Part of the study, every 3 months for one year and then every 6 months up to the maximum of 84 months
secondary_outcome.description: Safety analysis will be performed on AE by CTCAE grade, serious AEs and Study drug related AEs and the AEs leading to discontinuation of study drug.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with abnormal lab tests during the Extension Part
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Following the Core Part of the study, every 3 months for the first year and then every 6 months up to the maximum of 84 months
secondary_outcome.description: Safety analysis will be performed on lab abnormalities will be based on CTCAE grades

arm_group.description: 1090 patients will be randomized to receive BAF312 during the trial for a maximum of approximately 3 years (Core Part). Patients who meet all inclusion and none of the exclusion criteria will be treated with BAF312 daily. Following the Core Part, eligible patients enter the Extension Part during which all receive open-label BAF312 for a maximum of 84 additional months.

Matching Placebo administered orally during the Core Part of the trial. Following the Core Part, eligible patients enter the Extension Part during which all receive open-label BAF312 for a maximum of 84 additional months.

intervention.description: Patients will be randomized to receive BAF312. BAF312 will be provided in a dose titration from 0.25 mg to a 2 mg dose.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Prior history of relapsing remitting MS
- SPMS defined as progressive increase of disability over at least 6 months
- EDSS score of 3.0 to 6.5
- No relapse of corticosteroid treatment within 3 months
Exclusion Criteria:
- Women of child bearing potential must use reliable forms of contraception.
- Diagnosis of Macular edema during screening period
- Any medically unstable condition determined by investigator.
- Unable to undergo MRI scans
- Hypersensitivity to any study drugs or drugs of similar class Other protocol defined inclusion/exclusion may apply.
